segments.text: Something people don't know about me is that I used to be a professional juggler. I performed at children's parties and small events during college to help pay for my education.

A pivotal moment that shaped my path was when I dropped out of medical school to pursue software engineering. It was terrifying at the time, but I realized I was more passionate about building things than practicing medicine. My family thought I was crazy, but it turned out to be the best decision I ever made.

The biggest challenge I've faced was overcoming imposter syndrome in my first tech job. I felt like I didn't belong, but gradually I learned that everyone starts somewhere and it's okay to be a beginner.
